poem:
Title: "In the Valley of the Unseen"

Unseen, what secrets creep in power's shadow,
falling silent as stone in the pond of the past.
A castle topples, its gatekeeper no more.
Robinson rises, uncertain in his rule.
Echoes of guilt hum through the Ulster air,
An offbeat drum in the heartbeat gallery.
Each hand that touches the sceptre feels its chill,
While history whispers scandal, in the shadowed hill.
